48:32 [Marshall] One of the ways of looking back in time with a reef 研究珊瑚过去的其中一个办法

48:55 where you start to see the signature of a coral bleaching event. 在这里你开始看到 珊瑚白化事件的信号
49:00 [Marshall] By tracking back in time, by looking at the history of the reef, 通过回溯过去 查看珊瑚礁的历史
49:03 we're absolutely certain that what we're seeing now 我们绝对可以肯定现在看到的
49:06 is not a natural fluctuation. 不是一个自然波动
49:09 The cause is, unequivocally, global climate change, 很明确 起因就是全球气候变化
49:12 driven by emitting carbon into the atmosphere. 元凶就是大气中的碳排放
49:16 [Hoegh-Guldberg] I think a lot of people don't realize climate change is happening 我想很多人都没意识到 气候变化正在发生
49:20 because most of the extra heat trapped by greenhouse gases 因为滞留在温室气体里的额外热量
49:23 has been transferred to the oceans. 被转移到海洋了
49:27 When you burn fossil fuel... that's burning oil, gas or coal... 当化石燃料燃烧时… 也就是燃烧汽油 天然气或煤
49:32 carbon dioxide goes up into the atmosphere. 二氧化碳会上升到大气中
49:35 Carbon dioxide has the property that it's able to trap heat. 二氧化碳有保留热量的特性
49:40 So, the more you have in the atmosphere, 因此大气里的二氧化碳越多
49:42 the greater the amount of heat trapped by the Earth. 地球保留的热量就越多
49:46 It's a bit like putting extra wool into your sweater. 有点像往你的毛衣里添加额外的羊毛
49:50 What people don't know is that 93% 人们不知道的是
49:53 of the heat that's trapped is going into the ocean. 有百分之93滞留的热量 正在进入海洋 （93%被海洋吸收）
49:56 That's a lot of energy. 那是非常多的能量
49:59 If the oceans weren't doing this job of absorbing the heat, 如果海洋不吸收这些热量
50:02 the average surface temperature of the planet would be 122 Fahrenheit. 那么地球表面的温度 将会是50摄氏度
50:10 There are rates of change going on in tropical oceans, 在热带海洋里出现了变化率
50:14 which, if projected forward... 如果往前预测
50:16 it means that coral reefs are a likely casualty 那就意味着珊瑚礁极可能成为
50:19 of any global climate change. 任何全球气候变化的受害者
50:22 I published that in the peer-reviewed literature. 我在同行评议的读物里发表过这观点
